sections.heading: Any person who knowingly sells, offers or exposes for sale (except
sections.text:
in bulk as waste paper) any newspaper, magazine, periodical or other
publication, except a rare book, manuscript or educational text, from which
the cover or title page has been removed, or from which the title, trade
name, trade mark or other identification mark has been removed or
obliterated, is guilty of a petty offense.

sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Title Page Act.

sections.heading: Whoever violates any of the provisions of this Act shall be guilty of a
sections.text: petty offense and fined not less than $25 nor more than $100.
